subject: Ethics
title: Libya Intervention Debate
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Libya Intervention Debate.

hook.text: NATO bombed Libya in 2011 to protect civilians. A decade later, the country is a failed state.

buildup.text: Gaddafi threatened to massacre rebels in Benghazi. The UN authorized force to protect civilians.

discovery.text: NATO's intervention worked initiallyâ€”Benghazi was saved. But the mission expanded to regime change.

twist.text: After Gaddafi fell, Libya collapsed into civil war, slave markets, and chaos. No one planned for after.

climax.text: Libya became the case study against intervention: you can't bomb a country into democracy.

punchline.text: We saved a city and destroyed a country. Was it worth it?

quiz.question: What was the primary criticism of NATO's intervention in Libya?
options: The mission expanded from civilian protection to regime change with no post-war plan
NATO acted without any UN authorization or legal justification
NATO's military technology was insufficient to protect Libyan civilians
